org.trimou.handlebars

Interface HelperDefinition

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Options

    public interface HelperDefinition
    A helper definition metadata.
    Since:
    1.5
    Author:
    Martin Kouba

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder
      A value placeholder represents an expression which will be evaluated right before the helper execution.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getContentLiteralBlock()
      Note that the text is reconstructed and will not be an exact copy when "Set Delimiter" tags are used.
      Map<String,Object> getHash()
      The map may contain HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder instances during validation.
      default Object getParameter(int index, Object defaultValue) 
      List<Object> getParameters()
      The list may contain HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder instances during validation.
      MustacheTagInfo getTagInfo() 

    • Method Detail

      • getTagInfo

        MustacheTagInfo getTagInfo()
        Returns:
        the info about the associated tag

      • getParameters

        List<Object> getParameters()
        The list may contain HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder instances during validation.
        Returns:
        an immutable list of parameters

      • getParameter

        default Object getParameter(int index,
                            Object defaultValue)
        Parameters:
        index -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        the parameter at the specified position or the default value if not found
        Since:
        2.2.1

      • getHash

        Map<String,Object> getHash()
        The map may contain HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder instances during validation.
        Returns:
        an immutable "hash" map

      • getContentLiteralBlock

        String getContentLiteralBlock()
        Note that the text is reconstructed and will not be an exact copy when "Set Delimiter" tags are used.
        Returns:
        the reconstructed literal block (original text before compilation) the helper contains, or an empty string for variable tag helpers
        Since:
        1.7
        See Also:
        Segment.getLiteralBlock()
